CatDescriptText: Charles Cutrary, 7118 Hermitage Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "I don't think that the kids should be made to work to support or to contribute to the support of the family until they are able to go to work-in other words, until they become of age. I don't look on it as an obligation for the kids to take care of their parents."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Cutrary wearing hat and dark necktie with three diamonds, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
